definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: He was speechless when confronted with the elders' evidence and certificates.
sentences.chinese: 他在老人们出示的房产证面前无言以对。

sentences.english: Ali and high shan together to redeem the house property card.
sentences.chinese: 艾莉和高珊珊一同去赎回了房产证。

sentences.english: Repair to check in, have house property card convenient hand, checking contact…
sentences.chinese: 装修过方便入住，有房产证在手，看房联系。

sentences.english: Chang Li directly with beam implementation of house property card, but liang whilst dont agree.
sentences.chinese: 常丽直接跟梁守业要房产证，但是梁守业不同意。

definition: to transfer ownership (of a vehicle, securities etc)/(real estate) conveyancing
population (counted as number of households for census or taxation)/registered residence/residence permit/(in Hong Kong and Macau) bank account
a mortgage (loanword via Cantonese)/to buy property on a mortgage
